attributes.action: abandon plans to extend Police powers to hold without charge beyond the existing 28 day limit
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We believe that the current 28 day limit, already an extension of the previous 14 day limit, provides sufficient time for a diligent investigation to fashion an initial set of charges against suspects.

We view the proposed increase in detention before charge as a clear infringement of our civil liberties, open to considerable abuse and insufficiently justified by the current terrorist threat.

A small summary of Home Office figures on arrest and conviction rates under terrorism legislation taken from the Home Office's website:
1228 arrests in 5.5 years.
241 charged with terrorism related offences.
41 Terrorism Act convictions with 114 awaiting or at trial.

669 released without charge.
